Superhero adventure, starring Paul Rudd, Michael Douglas and Evangeline Lilly

programme.title: Paranormal Activity: The Ghost Dimension
programme.desc: A man moves into a new house along with his wife, daughter and younger brother, and finds an old camcorder and a box of videotapes. The siblings start watching the tapes, which turn out to be home movies shot by the property's previous owners, but by doing so, they unleash evil spirits into the world. Horror sequel, starring Chris J Murray and Brit Shaw

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Cop John Anderton is forced to go on the run when a supposedly infallible trio of psychics foretell he is about to kill a man he has never heard of. Convinced their prediction is false, he kidnaps one of the so-called precogs to prove his innocence - and stumbles across a complex conspiracy. Steven Spielberg's futuristic thriller, starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton and Max von Sydow(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II
programme.desc: Time-travelling teenager Marty McFly travels to the 21st century, where he has to save his children from a terrible fate. However, this proves to have unforeseen consequences when the future version of arch enemy Biff sees a chance to rewrite history for his own benefit, leaving Marty stuck in a twisted parallel universe. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Michael J Fox and Christopher Lloyd(n)

programme.title: Anaconda
programme.desc: Film-makers venture deep into the Amazon jungle to document the lives of a remote tribe. However, the expedition is hijacked by a crazed hunter who plans to use them as bait to catch a gigantic killer snake. Adventure, starring Jennifer Lopez, Jon Voight, Ice Cube, Eric Stoltz and Jonathan Hyde(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: An alien arrives on Earth, accompanied by an awesomely powerful robot, on a fateful mission - to decide if the human race deserves to continue - and if not, to wipe it out. The visitor is imprisoned in a military facility, but a scientist helps him escape, hoping to prove that mankind is worth saving. Sci-fi drama remake, starring Keanu Reeves and Jennifer Connelly(n)

programme.title: Clash of the Titans
programme.desc: The son of the Greek god Zeus is raised by humans and grows up to reject his immortal heritage in anger at the gods' cruel treatment of humans. He sets out on a quest to find a means to kill the evil lord of the underworld in revenge for his father's death, facing all manner of strange creatures. Mythological adventure, with Sam Worthington, Liam Neeson, Ralph Fiennes and Gemma Arterton(n)

programme.title: Into the Forest
programme.desc: An unexplained cataclysm devastates the world, rendering virtually all technology useless. Two teenage sisters living in the backwoods face a series of challenges as they struggle to survive in a world changed beyond all recognition. Sci-fi drama based on Jean Hegland's novel, starring Ellen Page and Evan Rachel Wood(n)

programme.title: Edward Scissorhands
programme.desc: A reclusive genius creates a boy but dies before completing him, leaving his brainchild with scissor-like blades in place of hands. A kindly woman from a nearby suburb takes pity on the lonely figure and welcomes him into her home. He quickly becomes a hit in the neighbourhood - but then his new friends start to turn against him. Tim Burton's fantasy, starring Johnny Depp, Winona Ryder, Dianne Wiest and Vincent Price(n)

programme.title: Anguish
programme.desc: A teenage girl has struggled with mental health issues all her life, experiencing anxiety attacks and hallucinations. She discovers that her condition may be the result of a spirit possessing her - a revelation that leaves her forced to choose whether to allow the entity to take her over utterly or to fight to keep it under control. Horror, starring Ryan Simpkins and Annika Marks(n)

programme.title: Friend Request
programme.desc: A teenager meets a girl online, only to find she is a demonic entity intent on killing her real friends. Horror, starring Alycia Debnam-Carey and William Moseley(n)

programme.title: Clash of the Titans
programme.desc: The son of the Greek god Zeus is raised by humans and grows up to reject his immortal heritage in anger at the gods' cruel treatment of humans. He sets out on a quest to find a means to kill the evil lord of the underworld in revenge for his father's death, facing all manner of strange creatures. Mythological adventure, with Sam Worthington, Liam Neeson, Ralph Fiennes and Gemma Arterton(n)

programme.title: Into the Forest
programme.desc: An unexplained cataclysm devastates the world, rendering virtually all technology useless. Two teenage sisters living in the backwoods face a series of challenges as they struggle to survive in a world changed beyond all recognition. Sci-fi drama based on Jean Hegland's novel, starring Ellen Page and Evan Rachel Wood(n)

programme.title: Hacked
programme.desc: A student watches a video of a murder on the internet, but the police refuse to believe the events in the film are real. She sets out to prove someone really has been killed, only to find herself trapped in a deadly game and in danger of becoming the murderer's next target. Thriller, starring Melanie Papalia and David Schlachtenhaufen(n)

programme.title: Raging Bull
programme.desc: Biopic of boxer Jake LaMotta, who rose to fame as the world middleweight champion in the 1940s. His career was marred by an inability to deal with his anger, leaving his family bearing the brunt of his rage and paranoia. Directed by Martin Scorsese and starring an Oscar-winning Robert De Niro alongside Joe Pesci and Cathy Moriarty

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: A shy, withdrawn teenager discovers she has paranormal powers, which she uses to protect herself from her abusive mother and classmates. When a friendly student invites her to the prom, she is determined to enjoy herself and is amazed when she is crowned queen of the ball - but joy turns to fury when her tormentors play a cruel prank. Brian De Palma's adaptation of Stephen King's horror novel, with Sissy Spacek, Piper Laurie and Amy Irving

programme.title: The Blue Max
programme.desc: A low-born German fighter pilot's determination to win the flying corps' highest award rankles with his aristocratic comrades. Meanwhile, his clandestine affair with the wife of his commanding officer risks endangering lives and destroying his own reputation. First World War drama based on Jack D Hunter's novel, starring George Peppard, Ursula Andress, James Mason and Jeremy Kemp

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: The most rebellious Allied prisoners of war are sent to a supposedly escape-proof maximum-security detention camp during the Second World War. They plan an ingenious mass breakout by digging a tunnel, but even when free of the camp, making it across occupied Europe proves a dangerous journey. Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: The Insider
programme.desc: A scientist is fired from his job with a tobacco company, and agrees to expose his former employers' secrets to a journalist - including the allegation that the company had deliberately increased the addictive quality of cigarettes. Michael Mann's fact-based drama, starring Al Pacino, Russell Crowe, Christopher Plummer, Diane Venora and Philip Baker Hall

programme.title: Inception
programme.desc: A talented thief uses hi-tech devices to enter other people's dreams so he can steal their secrets. An industrialist hires him to perform a far more challenging job - to implant an idea into a corporate heir's mind, so he will think it is his own. However, the mission is compromised by the thief's own troubled psyche. Christopher Nolan's sci-fi thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Ellen Page, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Tom Hardy

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: The most rebellious Allied prisoners of war are sent to a supposedly escape-proof maximum-security detention camp during the Second World War. They plan an ingenious mass breakout by digging a tunnel, but even when free of the camp, making it across occupied Europe proves a dangerous journey. Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: The Insider
programme.desc: A scientist is fired from his job with a tobacco company, and agrees to expose his former employers' secrets to a journalist - including the allegation that the company had deliberately increased the addictive quality of cigarettes. Michael Mann's fact-based drama, starring Al Pacino, Russell Crowe, Christopher Plummer, Diane Venora and Philip Baker Hall

programme.title: Kill Zone 2
programme.desc: An undercover cop is locked up in a brutal Thai prison, and must work together with a guard to survive. Action thriller sequel, starring Tony Jaa and Jing Wu. In Mandarin, Cantonese, Thai and English

programme.title: Eyes Wide Shut
programme.desc: A successful doctor is shocked to discover his wife once harboured feelings for another man and resolves to get even by embarking on an affair of his own - only to end up involved with a dangerous exclusive cult. Stanley Kubrick's drama, starring Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman, Sydney Pollack and Marie Richardson

programme.title: A Dirty Shame
programme.desc: A bump on the head transforms a sexually repressed housewife into a sex-addicted exhibitionist - who, finding her husband can no longer fulfil her needs, goes in search of satisfaction in Baltimore's seedy underworld. John Waters' comedy, starring Tracey Ullman, Johnny Knoxville, Selma Blair and Chris Isaak

programme.title: The Crow's Egg
programme.desc: Comedy-drama following a pair of poverty stricken Indian brothers determined to earn the money to eat at a new pizza parlour. Starring Vignesh, Ramesh and Iyshwarya Rajesh

programme.title: The Burning
programme.desc: A mysterious man attempts to rescue a young woman who has been kidnapped by the mercenaries who murdered her father and took control of his farm. Argentinean Western drama, starring Gael Garcia Bernal, Alice Braga and Claudio Tolcachir

programme.title: Evolution
programme.desc: A youngster growing up in a town inhabited only by boys and women makes a strange discovery in the ocean that leaves him convinced that secrets are being kept from him. When he is taken to hospital for a series of procedures, he discovers the terrible truth about his home. Sci-fi mystery, starring Max Brebant and Roxane Duran. In French

programme.title: Bluebird
programme.desc: During a freezing cold winter in the frozen woods of an isolated Maine logging town, a lapse of concentration has devastating consequences for a school bus driver. Drama, starring Amy Morton, John Slattery and Louisa Krause

programme.title: Our Little Sister
programme.desc: Three sisters who share a house together receive word that their estranged father has died. They travel to attend his funeral, only to discover he has a teenage daughter by another mother, who is now an orphan. They invite the girl to live with them, sparking a journey of self-discovery for all four women. Drama based on Akimi Yoshida's comic book series, starring Haruka Ayase, Masami Nagasawa, Kaho and Suzu Hirose. In Japanese

programme.title: Rebel Without a Cause
programme.desc: An angry teenage social outcast rejects any form of authority in his search for a sense of identity. Eventually, he finds solace in the company of two like-minded and equally alienated misfits. However, a spate of violent confrontations forces them to go on the run, and their plan to stay in hiding has tragic consequences. Drama, starring James Dean, Natalie Wood, Sal Mineo and Jim Backus

programme.title: Warsaw 44
programme.desc: A factory worker in Nazi occupied Poland joins a resistance movement. He finds himself torn between two very different women, but all three of them will be drawn into a growing conflict as the approach of the Soviet army inspires the rebels to launch a climactic battle against their oppressors. Second World War drama, starring Jozef Pawlowski and Zofia Wichlacz. In Polish and German

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: An inexperienced financial trader is taken under the wing of a corrupt New York corporate raider, who draws him into the shady world of illegal insider dealing with promises of money and power. But the trainee stockbroker questions the morality of his actions when the consequences of a deal strike close to home. Oliver Stone's Oscar-winning drama, starring Michael Douglas, father and son Martin and Charlie Sheen, Daryl Hannah and Terence Stamp

programme.title: Maggie's Plan
programme.desc: A young New Yorker's plan to have a kid on her own is derailed when she falls for a married man. Romantic comedy, starring Greta Gerwig, Ethan Hawke and Bill Hader

programme.title: American Beauty
programme.desc: A suburban family man has a mid-life crisis when he becomes infatuated with a friend of his teenage daughter. Struggling to cope with the unhealthy attention her father is lavishing on her friend, the girl begins a tentative relationship of her own, while her harassed mother is also having an affair. Sam Mendes' Oscar-winning black comedy drama, starring Kevin Spacey, Annette Bening, Thora Birch, Mena Suvari and Wes Bentley

programme.title: Garden State
programme.desc: A TV actor shuffles through life emotionally numbed by the drugs prescribed for him by his stern psychiatrist father. However, he decides to ditch the pills when returning home for his mother's funeral. Free of medication, his apathy begins to lift, and an eccentric local woman reawakens his joy for life. Romantic drama, written, directed by and starring Zach Braff, with Natalie Portman and Ian Holm(n)

programme.title: Valley of Love
programme.desc: An estranged couple meet for the first time in years in Death Valley, California, having responded to a message left for them by their dead son, who committed suicide six months previously. They are instructed to visit a series of locations in the desert, with the promise that their son's ghost will appear to them. Drama, starring Isabelle Huppert and Gerard Depardieu. In French and English(n)

programme.title: Honeytrap
programme.desc: A Brixton teenager's misguided attempts to attract the attention of a heartless wannabe rapper have terrible results. Drama, starring Jessica Sula, Lucien Laviscount and Ntonga Mwanza(n)

programme.title: Exit
programme.desc: A lonely middle-aged woman becomes drawn to a man she meets while caring for her hospitalised mother-in-law. Taiwanese drama, starring Shiang-chyi Chen, Ming-hsiang Tung and Ming-Hua Pai(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Shore
programme.desc: A wife's husband returns to her three years after he drowned at sea, and she agrees to let him take her on a journey. Drama, starring Eri Fukatsu and Tadanobu Asano(n)

programme.title: Theeb
programme.desc: A Bedouin boy living in an Ottoman province during the First World War offers to help his brother guide a British officer on a perilous journey through the desert to a secret destination. He gradually becomes more aware of the devastating events occurring in the world around him and is forced to grow up quickly. Drama, starring Jacir Eid Al-Hwietat and Jack Fox. In Arabic(n)

programme.title: Partisan
programme.desc: A young boy raised to be an assassin starts to question the ways of his community's charismatic and domineering leader. Drama, with Vincent Cassel, Jeremy Chabriel and Florence Mezzara(n)

programme.title: Summertime
programme.desc: An ambitious farmer's daughter travels to Paris in 1971, where she falls in love with a radical feminist. She finds herself obliged to return to the family farm, and her new lover accompanies her on the journey, but their relationship is greeted with disapproval. Romantic drama, starring Cecile De France and Izia Higelin. In French(n)

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: A bored millionaire masterminds a bank robbery, only to find himself pursued by a glamorous insurance investigator determined to prove his guilt. It is not long before they get embroiled in a passionate affair - but conflicting interests mean they can never really trust one another. Crime drama, starring Steve McQueen, Faye Dunaway, Paul Burke and Yaphet Kotto(n)

programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: An American writer and his wife arrive in a picturesque French seaside town in France, their marriage in the middle of a crisis. They form friendships with locals and fellow visitors, while trying to repair the cracks in their relationship. Drama, directed by and starring Angelina Jolie, with Brad Pitt and Melanie Laurent(n)

programme.title: Goat
programme.desc: New college student Brad is desperate to fit into his new surroundings, so taking a cue from his older brother, he decides to pledge a fraternity. All goes well at first as he attends parties and meets several girls, but as he enters into the final stretch of the pledging ritual-known as hell week, Brad finds things taking a violent turn as he has to endure a series of brutal initiation rituals. Fact-based drama, with Ben Schnetzer and Nick Jonas(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Misanthropic Korean War veteran Walt leads an isolated existence, and has a tense relationship with his family and nothing but contempt for his neighbours. When a teenager attempts to steal his prized car, he ends up trying to reform the thief, making a connection with the boy's relatives and defending them from a street gang. Drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Christopher Carley and Bee Vang(n)

programme.title: God's Pocket
programme.desc: A construction worker believes his life will be simpler following the death of his troublemaking stepson. However, he finds things go from bad to worse as his relationship with his wife deteriorates and a reporter grows suspicious about the tragedy. Drama based on Peter Dexter's novel, starring Philip Seymour Hoffman, Christina Hendricks and John Turturro(n)

programme.title: Psycho
programme.desc: A woman on the run after stealing from her boss ends up at an isolated motel, where the owner's curious relationship with his domineering mother results in murder. Alfred Hitchcock's psychological thriller, starring Anthony Perkins, Janet Leigh, Vera Miles, Martin Balsam, John Gavin and John McIntire(n)

programme.title: Brother
programme.desc: A Japanese gangster exiled to America forms an unholy alliance with his drug-dealing half brother, and the pair embark on a battle for LA's prime drug turf. Crime thriller, directed by and starring Takeshi Kitano, with Omar Epps and Claude Maki

programme.title: Honey, I Shrunk the Kids
programme.desc: A professor invents a ray with the power to reduce objects in size. Unfortunately, his kids and their meddling friends activate it and are shrunk to microscopic proportions. When they are accidentally thrown out with the rubbish, the children have to contend with all kinds of animals and insects on their journey home across the backyard. Disney comedy, with Rick Moranis, Marcia Strassman and Amy O'Neill

programme.title: Epic
programme.desc: A teenager wanders into a forest that her scientist father believes is home to a race of miniature people. She stumbles on the tiny creatures and is shrunk down to their size so she can carry out a quest to save their new queen from an invading army. Animated adventure, with the voices of Amanda Seyfried, Josh Hutcherson, Colin Farrell and Christoph Waltz

programme.title: Rio 2
programme.desc: Parrots Jewel and Blu lead a happy life together in Rio with their three chicks, until they find themselves hurled into an expedition up the Amazon. The journey leads to an encounter with an old enemy, while Blu also has to win the approval of Jewel's fearsome father. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jesse Eisenberg, Anne Hathaway and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Paddington
programme.desc: An earthquake forces a bear from the Peruvian jungle to start a new life in London. He finds modern Britain to be very different from the stories told to him by his aunt, but makes a new home with a kindly family. However, a sinister taxidermist intends to turn him into a museum exhibit. Comedy based on Michael Bond's series of children's books, starring Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman, with the voice of Ben Whishaw

programme.title: St Trinian's 2: The Legend of Fritton's Gold
programme.desc: The mischievous schoolgirls embark on a hunt for buried treasure after learning their headmistress Miss Fritton is a descendant of pirates. However, they face competition in the form of a dastardly lord eager to locate the loot for himself. Comedy sequel, starring Rupert Everett, Gemma Arterton, Colin Firth, David Tennant and Talulah Riley

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: A repairman is assigned to salvage the remaining resources from Earth, which has been left a devastated wasteland after a war with an alien race. He discovers a human survivor on the surface of the planet, an encounter that exposes secrets from the past that threaten the future of the human race. Sci-fi adventure, starring Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Terminator Salvation
programme.desc: In a future dominated by the deadly robots, resistance leader John Connor fights to stop the creation of an advanced new terminator and searches for the teenager destined to go back in time and become his father. Elsewhere, a mysterious stranger with no memory is about to learn the shocking truth about his origins. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Christian Bale, Sam Worthington and Anton Yelchin

programme.title: Mindscape
programme.desc: A psychic with the ability to explore people's memories uses his talents to aid the police, until a case goes disastrously wrong. Desperate for work, he agrees to help a wealthy couple discover why their teenage daughter is on a hunger strike, but beings to fear she is manipulating her memories to deceive him. Fantasy thriller, starring Mark Strong, Taissa Farmiga and Brian Cox

programme.title: The Muppet Movie
programme.desc: Kermit the frog is persuaded by his agent that he has a future in movies. He sets off on a journey across America to realise his dream, gathering a crowd of like-minded friends along the way - but the owner of a French restaurant plans to make him the dish of the day. Comedy, starring Dom DeLuise and Charles Durning alongside the puppet characters, with cameos from Mel Brooks, Orson Welles and Steve Martin

programme.title: The Spy Next Door
programme.desc: A Chinese secret agent falls in love with a single mother while helping the CIA apprehend a terrorist, and decides to quit the espionage business. He offers to look after her three kids for the weekend, but struggles to cope with their mischief-making - and to make matters worse, the terrorist escapes from prison. Comedy, with Jackie Chan and Magnus Scheving

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A casino magnate approaches a group of no-hopers with the offer of $2million to whoever retrieves the sum from a locker in a train station in New Mexico, prompting a madcap cross-continent dash. Meanwhile, the casino owner's high-rolling gambler friends place bets on which of the bumbling contestants will win. Comedy, with Rowan Atkinson, John Cleese, Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Bates, Seth Green and Cuba Gooding Jr

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Elizabeth Bennet is one of five sisters whose mother is determined to find them suitable husbands. The arrival of a wealthy gentleman and his friends at a nearby mansion leads to an introduction between Elizabeth and the aloof Mr Darcy, to whom she takes an instant dislike. However, an unexpected attraction eventually develops. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, starring Keira Knightley, Matthew Macfadyen and Judi Dench

programme.title: Airplane
programme.desc: The passengers on board an ill-fated airliner become increasingly jittery when the flight crew flounder during a food-poisoning crisis. As ground control personnel struggle heroically to ensure the plane lands safely, a traumatised war veteran must face his fear to take the controls. Spoof disaster movie, starring Robert Hays, Leslie Nielsen, Robert Stack and Lloyd Bridges

programme.title: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 1
programme.desc: Katniss Everdeen is brought to a secretive underground society following the destruction of the televised deathmatch. She becomes the figurehead of a revolution against the despotic Panem regime, while her friend Peeta remains a captive of its tyrannical president. Part one of the two-part conclusion to the sci-fi adventure series, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Julianne Moore and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: The Host
programme.desc: Earth is invaded by parasitic aliens which possess humans, but one of the creatures discovers the consciousness of her teenage host has not been fully repressed. The human part of their personality persuades her to turn her back on her race and seek out free humans, leading her to a resistance group fighting to free mankind. Sci-fi adventure, starring Saoirse Ronan, Max Irons and William Hurt

programme.title: Intruders
programme.desc: Two children, one in London the other in Madrid, are visited in the night by the same mysterious ghostly figure, whom they appear to be unconsciously willing into existence. The Spanish boy's mother turns to the church for help in dealing with the intrusion, while the English girl's father employs a more scientific approach. Horror, starring Clive Owen, Pilar Lopez de Ayala and Carice van Houten(n)

programme.title: The Great Muppet Caper
programme.desc: Reporters Kermit the Frog and Fozzie Bear are sacked for missing out on a massive scoop about the theft of jewellery from famous British fashion designer Lady Holiday. To try to re-establish their reputations, the duo and Gonzo fly to London to see if they can track down the culprit. Comedy, with the voices of Jim Henson and Frank Oz, with cameo appearances by John Cleese, Diana Rigg, Charles Grodin and Peter Ustinov(n)

programme.title: Flight of the Navigator
programme.desc: A boy mysteriously disappears in 1978, and is found eight years later, having not aged a day. He escapes being experimented on by government scientists by taking off in a crashed alien spaceship. With the help of the robot pilot, he tries to find out what has happened to him and if he can get back home. Sci-fi adventure, starring Joey Cramer and Veronica Cartwright, with the voice of Paul Reubens(n)

programme.title: Chalet Girl
programme.desc: A 19-year-old skateboarding champion gives up the sport as she struggles to support herself and her father. She gets a job working in a ski resort, where she feels out of her comfort zone in high society, but she finds a way to put her old skills to good use by competing in a prestigious snowboarding competition. Comedy, with Felicity Jones, Ed Westwick and Bill Nighy(n)

programme.title: The Princess Diaries
programme.desc: An ordinary teenager discovers she is descended from royal stock and her grandmother is a queen. However, when this formidable regal lady insists she learn to behave like a princess, life suddenly becomes very complicated. Family comedy, starring Anne Hathaway, Julie Andrews, Heather Matarazzo and Hector Elizondo(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: A scientist and four members of his crew develop superhuman powers after exposure to cosmic radiation on a mission to study an energy storm in space. Unfortunately, one of them chooses to use his new-found abilities for evil purposes, compelling the others to join forces to stop him. Sci-fi comic-book adventure, starring Ioan Gruffudd, Jessica Alba, Chris Evans, Michael Chiklis and Julian McMahon(n)

programme.title: Riddick
programme.desc: A fugitive is left for dead by his treacherous followers on a dangerous world full of lethal predators. He lures bounty hunters to the planet in the hope of killing them and stealing their spacecraft, but finds himself forced to work with them against an attack by the monsters at the top of the food chain. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel and Katee Sackhoff(n)

programme.title: Hellboy
programme.desc: A thwarted Nazi experiment lands the Allies with an unexpected visitor from another dimension in the form of a bright-red demon. A secretive US government agency fosters the little devil and he grows up to be its crucial weapon against the forces of darkness - but the re-emergence of the sinister wizard Rasputin proves a challenge even for him. Action fantasy based on the comic-book series, with Ron Perlman, John Hurt, Selma Blair and Karel Roden(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The validity of the Waltons' claim to their land is questioned, so John-Boy takes a trip to the city to raise the $200 required for his family to register their right, while his younger siblings do their bit at home. Richard Thomas stars

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: When Verdie Grant learns her daughter is graduating from college, she feels embarrassed by the fact that she never learned to read or write. She asks John-Boy to teach her, on the condition that he keeps it a secret. Richard Thomas stars

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: There's No Place Like Home - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The residents of Walnut Grove work hard to restore the town to its former glory for founder Lars Hanson, who the Ingalls family discovers has been crippled by a stroke. Drama, starring Michael Landon, Karen Grassle and Melissa Gilbert

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Albert runs away from home, convinced Laura thinks he is trying to steal her father's affection

programme.title: Beyond the Blackboard
programme.desc: A newly qualified teacher sets up a makeshift classroom for homeless teenagers. Initially afraid and suspicious of her students, she gradually gets to know them and becomes determined to make a difference to their difficult lives. Fact-based drama, starring Emily VanCamp, Steve Talley and Treat Williams

programme.title: Love at the Christmas Table
programme.desc: Family friends Sam and Kat grew up on together, spending every Christmas Eve at the children's table. They have shared the highs and lows of early adulthood, but as he grows older Sam begins to realise the affection may be more deeper than he had imagined. Drama, starring Danica McKellar, Dustin Milligan and Lea Thompson

programme.title: Prison of Secrets
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a new convict in a women's prison, who struggles to expose a corrupt system under which guards demand sexual favours from her fellow inmates. Stephanie Zimbalist, Finola Hughes and Gary Frank star

programme.title: The Disappearing Act
programme.desc: A distraught mother turns detective to find out the truth behind her son's disappearance, concerned he may have met with foul play at the hands of his beautiful but volatile girlfriend. Fact-based drama, starring Patty Duke, Kelly Rowan and Robert Floyd

programme.title: A Question of Guilt
programme.desc: A divorcee's hedonistic lifestyle is greeted with disapproval, and the weight of public opinion swings against her when she is accused of murdering her children. Courtroom drama, starring Tuesday Weld and Ron Leibman

programme.title: Agatha Christie's A Caribbean Mystery
programme.desc: Miss Marple arrives in the Bahamas for rest and recuperation, where she encounters a retired army officer with a secret to reveal. He claims to have proof that a guest at the resort is a killer, but before he can specify who, he is poisoned and the incriminating evidence disappears. It falls to the indomitable amateur sleuth to unmask the culprit. Drama, with Helen Hayes, Barnard Hughes, Season Hubley and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Sparkling Cyanide
programme.desc: Modern reworking of Agatha Christie's classic murder mystery, starring Pauline Collins, Oliver Ford Davies, Kenneth Cranham and Susan Hampshire. A football chairman hosts a glitzy party to celebrate a new signing, but as the guests raise their glasses to toast a successful future, his wife suddenly drops dead. A pair of MI5 agents are called in to investigate, and it's not long before the finger of suspicion points at the victim's husband - until he too is murdered

programme.title: Boss of Bosses
programme.desc: Biopic of Mafia boss Paul Castellano who rose rapidly through the ranks of organised crime to become the head of one of New York's biggest `families'. Renowned for meting out rough justice, he seemed to command the respect of cops and criminals alike - but despite his power, he was assassinated by a rival for his privileged position. Starring Chazz Palminteri, Angela Alvarado, Clancy Brown and Jay O Sanders

programme.title: The Score
programme.desc: A safecracker comes dangerously close to getting caught red-handed, so decides the time has come to quit his life of crime. However, an old friend soon tempts him back with the chance to steal a priceless French artefact being stored in a customs house, and he joins forces with a talented young thief to carry out one last heist. Crime thriller, starring Robert De Niro, Edward Norton, Marlon Brando and Angela Bassett

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: An unpopular restaurant critic is found murdered and ceremonially mutilated in his kitchen, and a petty thief linked to the scene of the crime becomes prime suspect. However, it soon transpires that the acerbic writer had a secret double life and bigger fish to fry - and that the killer's work is not yet over. Drama, guest starring Stella Gonet, Clare Hemphill and Struan Rodger

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Budding writer John-Boy helps a local blacksmith compose a poem that will win the hand of his sweetheart. Starring Richard Thomas

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy receives a proposal of marriage from his insecure friend Sarah. However, when he fails to take her seriously she elopes with another boy instead - and he sets out to find the errant couple before they tie the knot. Sissy Spacek guest stars

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mr Olesen begins writing a gossip column, causing considerable local interest and resentment from some quarters. Drama, starring Michael Landon

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary expresses fears over marrying Adam Kendall, as she doubts they could safely raise children together

programme.title: Pastor Brown
programme.desc: Premiere. Exotic dancer Jesse returns home for the first time in a decade after her father becomes terminally ill. She must reconnect with her family and take over his congregation, but not all are happy. Drama, starring Salli Richardson-Whitfield, India Arie and Nicole Ari Parker

programme.title: A Dad for Christmas
programme.desc: A 19-year-old father visits his newborn son in hospital for the first time, only to find the boy's mother has already put him up for adoption. In desperation, he kidnaps the baby and hides out at his grandmother's house. Drama, starring Kristopher Turner, Louise Fletcher, Lindsay Ames and Dino Bellisario

programme.title: November Christmas
programme.desc: A father whose daughter is seriously ill fears she will not live through the year. He is determined to make sure her remaining time is happy, and with the help of his neighbours, he arranges to celebrate Halloween and Christmas months ahead of schedule so she can enjoy both holidays. Drama, starring John Corbett and Sam Elliott

programme.title: A Smile as Big as the Moon
programme.desc: A teacher of children with learning difficulties believes that his pupils will benefit from a special education programme set up at the US Space and Rocket Center for students with a gift for science. However, he faces an uphill struggle to get them accepted onto the course. Fact-based drama, starring John Corbett and Jessy Schram

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John and Olivia begin preparations for their 20th wedding anniversary, and John-Boy falls in love with an older woman

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: When the Ingalls girls go swimming, their friend Ellen Taylor gets trapped underwater and drowns, and her grief-stricken mother begins to imagine that Laura is Ellen

programme.title: A Wedding on Walton's Mountain
programme.desc: Drama based on the popular TV series. Erin's happy engagement to Paul Northridge is put in doubt by Ashley's unexpected return from the war, leaving her facing an impossible decision between suitors. Ralph Waite, Mary Beth McDonough, Louis Welch and Morgan Stevens star

programme.title: A Walton Wedding
programme.desc: Eldest son John-Boy, now a journalist living in 1960s New York, invites the family to attend his wedding, but finds them taking over the planning. In need of solitude, he returns home to research an article on his grandmother's life. Family drama based on the TV series, starring Richard Thomas, Ralph Waite, Michael Learned and Kate McNeil

programme.title: William and Catherine: A Royal Romance
programme.desc: A dramatised account of the courtship of Prince William and his St Andrews sweetheart Catherine Middleton. Picking up the story at a pivotal moment in their romance, the film follows William as he heeds advice from his mother, the late Princess Diana, which she bestowed in an interview before her death in 1997. Drama, starring Dan Amboyer and Alice St Clair

programme.title: Convoy
programme.desc: A renegade trucker clashes with a redneck sheriff and the authorities in general as he leads a mammoth convoy across America. Sam Pekinpah's road movie inspired by the song by CW McCall, starring Kris Kristofferson, Ali MacGraw, Ernest Borgnine, Burt Young and Madge Sinclair

programme.title: Runaway Car
programme.desc: The accelerator on a woman's car jams, leaving its passengers facing a terrifying ordeal as they attempt to find a way of bringing the vehicle to a stop. Action thriller, with Judge Reinhold, Nina Siemaszko, Brian Hooks and Leon

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Kind-hearted John-Boy gives up a date with a beautiful woman to accompany an elderly Scottish lady on the most important journey of her life(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy's peace and quiet is disrupted by an old schoolfriend who desperately needs his help. Sissy Spacek guest stars(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Charles and Jonathan plan to show the boys a few things about the responsibilities of adulthood, but the tables are swiftly turned. Drama, starring Michael Landon(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The Walnut Grove school children take tests to prepare them for the next year, but after Andy fails, his parents ask Nels to tutor him. However, he advises him to get ahead by dishonest means(n)

programme.title: Expecting a Miracle
programme.desc: A married couple with problems starting a family decide to have a romantic break in Mexico, but en route their car breaks down in a small hamlet. Stranded for a few days, they are drawn into the preparations for a fiesta - and experiencing the villagers' contented way of life gives them a new perspective on their troubles. Drama, with Jason Priestley, Teri Polo and Cheech Marin(n)

programme.title: A Thousand Heroes
programme.desc: Tense drama based on the real-life story of a heroic pilot forced to make a spectacular emergency landing in Iowa, and the ground staff's attempts to save all 296 people on board his aircraft. Charlton Heston, James Coburn and Richard Thomas star(n)

programme.title: Blessed Stranger: After Flight 111
programme.desc: A woman whose teenage daughter was lost in a plane crash in Nova Scotia hopes to find evidence that she somehow survived. A fisherman who was involved in the rescue effort retrieved the missing girl's sweater from the wreckage, and the desperate mother visits him in the hope that he can help find her. Drama, with Kate Nelligan, Hugh Thompson, Stacy Smith and Janet Kidder(n)

programme.title: The Triumph
programme.desc: An idealistic teacher gives up his small-town job in favour of a new life in New York, where he takes up the challenge of working in one of the country's toughest schools. Fact-based drama, starring Matthew Perry, with Ernie Hudson and Hannah Hodson(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John is rushed to hospital with pneumonia, leaving the rest of the family to cope with their financial hardship(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary mistakenly jumps to the conclusion that her mother has fallen for Chris, the handsome handyman they have hired to finish work on the house(n)

programme.title: Outrage
programme.desc: An affluent Californian community is terrorised by a street gang, until one of the residents starts fighting back. Fact-based crime drama, starring Robert Culp and Marlyn Mason(n)

programme.title: A Walton Easter
programme.desc: The children of the mountain clan are grown up and living separate lives by the 1960s. They all return to their old mountain homestead to celebrate parents John and Olivia's 40th wedding anniversary. Drama spin-off from the TV series, starring Ralph Waite, Michael Learned, Richard Thomas and Lisa Harrison(n)

programme.title: Three Weeks, Three Kids
programme.desc: A couple with three children plan a three-week holiday without the kids, and the wife's mother offers to look after them. However, she has an ulterior motive - she thinks her carefree younger daughter could do with a lesson in adult responsibility, and arranges for the youngsters to be left in her care. Comedy, starring Anna Chlumsky and Warren Christie(n)

programme.title: The Jazz Singer
programme.desc: A Jewish cantor's son goes against his strict father's wishes and travels to Los Angeles in search of fame and fortune. Remake of the 1927 musical drama, starring Neil Diamond in the role originally played by Al Jolson, with Laurence Olivier, Lucie Arnaz and Catlin Adams(n)

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of a woman from the well-heeled Clydeside sailing fraternity reunites Matt Burke with an old flame. The victim's husband immediately falls under suspicion - but the discovery of two more bodies makes it clear there are other members of the seafaring set with blood on their hands(n)

programme.title: Moonlight & Mistletoe
programme.desc: A businesswoman returns home to help out her Dad's business Santaland after he suffers an injury. Despite her initial reluctance, she soon comes to appreciate the family trade. Drama, starring Candace Cameron Bure, Tom Arnold, Christopher Wiehl and Barbara Niven

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The validity of the Waltons' claim to their land is questioned, so John-Boy takes a trip to the city to raise the $200 required for his family to register their right, while his younger siblings do their bit at home. Richard Thomas stars

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: When Verdie Grant learns her daughter is graduating from college, she feels embarrassed by the fact that she never learned to read or write. She asks John-Boy to teach her, on the condition that he keeps it a secret. Richard Thomas stars

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: There's No Place Like Home - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The residents of Walnut Grove work hard to restore the town to its former glory for founder Lars Hanson, who the Ingalls family discovers has been crippled by a stroke. Drama, starring Michael Landon, Karen Grassle and Melissa Gilbert

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Albert runs away from home, convinced Laura thinks he is trying to steal her father's affection

programme.title: Beyond the Blackboard
programme.desc: A newly qualified teacher sets up a makeshift classroom for homeless teenagers. Initially afraid and suspicious of her students, she gradually gets to know them and becomes determined to make a difference to their difficult lives. Fact-based drama, starring Emily VanCamp, Steve Talley and Treat Williams

programme.title: Love at the Christmas Table
programme.desc: Family friends Sam and Kat grew up on together, spending every Christmas Eve at the children's table. They have shared the highs and lows of early adulthood, but as he grows older Sam begins to realise the affection may be more deeper than he had imagined. Drama, starring Danica McKellar, Dustin Milligan and Lea Thompson

programme.title: Prison of Secrets
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a new convict in a women's prison, who struggles to expose a corrupt system under which guards demand sexual favours from her fellow inmates. Stephanie Zimbalist, Finola Hughes and Gary Frank star

programme.title: The Disappearing Act
programme.desc: A distraught mother turns detective to find out the truth behind her son's disappearance, concerned he may have met with foul play at the hands of his beautiful but volatile girlfriend. Fact-based drama, starring Patty Duke, Kelly Rowan and Robert Floyd

programme.title: A Question of Guilt
programme.desc: A divorcee's hedonistic lifestyle is greeted with disapproval, and the weight of public opinion swings against her when she is accused of murdering her children. Courtroom drama, starring Tuesday Weld and Ron Leibman

programme.title: Agatha Christie's A Caribbean Mystery
programme.desc: Miss Marple arrives in the Bahamas for rest and recuperation, where she encounters a retired army officer with a secret to reveal. He claims to have proof that a guest at the resort is a killer, but before he can specify who, he is poisoned and the incriminating evidence disappears. It falls to the indomitable amateur sleuth to unmask the culprit. Drama, with Helen Hayes, Barnard Hughes, Season Hubley and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Sparkling Cyanide
programme.desc: Modern reworking of Agatha Christie's classic murder mystery, starring Pauline Collins, Oliver Ford Davies, Kenneth Cranham and Susan Hampshire. A football chairman hosts a glitzy party to celebrate a new signing, but as the guests raise their glasses to toast a successful future, his wife suddenly drops dead. A pair of MI5 agents are called in to investigate, and it's not long before the finger of suspicion points at the victim's husband - until he too is murdered

programme.title: Boss of Bosses
programme.desc: Biopic of Mafia boss Paul Castellano who rose rapidly through the ranks of organised crime to become the head of one of New York's biggest `families'. Renowned for meting out rough justice, he seemed to command the respect of cops and criminals alike - but despite his power, he was assassinated by a rival for his privileged position. Starring Chazz Palminteri, Angela Alvarado, Clancy Brown and Jay O Sanders

programme.title: Recess Reset
programme.desc: Congress may be in recess but Mark Halperin is on the job, covering the White House and the Syria fallout. John Heilemann and Mark McKinnon hit the road to see what Americans think about how President Trump is handling the situation

London, 1971. In an age of open racism, fervent nationalism and anti-establishment passion, two politically engaged and idealistic young lovers, Marcus Hill and Jas Mitra, fight back against the injustice and deep-rooted prejudice they face on a daily basis. But, unbeknownst to them, they are being targeted by Special Branch's Black Power Desk, led by police officer DCI Nicholas Pence and his deputy, Cullen. Limited series premiere

programme.title: Sic Transit Imperium
programme.desc: Axe is offered inside information from a former employee and considers whether to use it. Chuck faces external pressure to drop an ongoing investigation. Lara plans a lavish birthday celebration for Axe only to discover he's lied to her about his relationship with Wendy. Chuck is willing to support Ira and Senior's investment in a company about to go public

programme.title: My Justice
programme.desc: Online, any of us can become judge, jury and executioner. But in this ever-shifting digital world, how do we draw the line between the rule of law, and a digital lynch mob? In this episode, an amateur sleuth seeks justice in the case of a young woman's mysterious death - only to discover that the accused killer is the real victim. Elsewhere, a digital activist takes a stand for social justice then finds himself forced to choose between prison and exile(c)

programme.title: NASA
programme.desc: It's time to take a closer look at the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, a government agency that spends scads of taxpayer money to achieve what private industry might be able to do more profitably and efficiently(c)

credits.director: Graphic Language, Adult Content, Brief Nudity

programme.title: Poltergeist III
programme.desc: Carole Anne is sent to live in a Chicago high-rise with her Uncle Bruce and his new wife, Pat. But that doesn't mean that she's escaped the apparitions that have haunted her in the past

programme.title: Inspector Gadget
programme.desc: A security guard's dreams come true when he is selected to be transformed into a cybernetic police officer. Matthew Broderick and Rupert Everett star

programme.title: Blue Crush
programme.desc: An adrenaline fueled surf film starring Kate Bosworth as a former surfing great still reeling from a horrifying injury but at the prodding of her friends, she signs up for a pro surfing competition that could change her life

programme.title: The Boy
programme.desc: A young woman (Lauren Cohan) takes a job as a nanny in a remote English village and soon discovers the family child is a life-sized doll - cared for like a real child as a way to cope with the death of their son 20 years prior

programme.title: Disgraced
programme.desc: A SHOWTIME feature-length documentary examining the 2003 murder of college basketball star Patrick Dennehy by teammate Carlton Dotson, and the subsequent accusations against both Baylor University and head coach Dave Bliss

programme.title: Shaun of the Dead
programme.desc: Shaun (Simon Pegg) and his friends are in for a literal night from hell when they meet up at the local pub only to find themselves fighting off hordes of brain-hungry undead. Penelope Wilton, Kate Ashfield, Lucy Davis and Bill Nighy co-star in this zombie-fraught romantic comedy

programme.title: Deja Vu
programme.desc: After a ferry is bombed in New Orleans, an ATF agent joins a unique investigation using experimental surveillance technology to find the bomber - but finds himself becoming obsessed with one of the victims. Denzel Washington stars

programme.title: No Country for Old Men
programme.desc: When a man stumbles upon a bloody crime scene, a pickup truck loaded with heroin and two million dollars in cash, his decision to take the money and run ignites an unstoppable chain reaction of violence and mayhem in writer/director Joel and Ethan Coen's Academy Award winning thriller. Starring Tommy Lee Jones, Javier Bardem and Josh Brolin

Directed by Emmy®-winning filmmaker Marina Zenovich and executive produced by Roy Ackerman and Pryor's widow, Jennifer Pryor

programme.title: Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live From Sin City
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Lavell Crawford (Breaking Bad) hosts this installment of Shaquille O'Neal's All Star Comedy Jam franchise in Las Vegas, featuring comedy veteran Earthquake who teams up with Cocoa Brown, K-Dubb, and Donell Rawlings to deliver a hilarious night of comedy

programme.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier
programme.desc: In this classic movie spin off from the TV series, Captain Kirk and his crew must deal with Spock's long-lost half-brother who hijacks the Enterprise for an obsessive search for God at the center of the galaxy. Stars William Shatner and Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
programme.desc: In this classic movie spin off from the TV series, Admiral Kirk and his crew risk their careers when they steal the decommissioned Enterprise to return to the restricted Genesis planet to recover Captain Spock's body. Stars William Shatner and Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: Prison Fighters: 5 Rounds to Freedom
programme.desc: A SHOWTIME feature-length documentary following two men in Thailand's modern day Prison Fight program, where convicted criminals are given the chance to fight for their release - and possible redemption, too - through the ancient tradition of Muay Thai matches

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Infinity
programme.desc: Dev Patel stars in this story of the life and academic career of the pioneer Indian mathematician, Srinivasa Ramanujan, who leaves his home country and his young bride to travel to Trinity College in England in 1931 and despite his brilliance and the help of an eccentric mentor, must fight to prove himself and his theories to the establishment. Co-stars Jeremy Irons

programme.title: IVERSON
programme.desc: Feature-length documentary charting the rise of basketball great Allen Iverson, told largely in his own words. From a turbulent childhood of crushing poverty in Virginia to controversial run-ins with the law to iconic Philadelphia 76ers all star, his audacious rejection of convention and off the court embrace of hip-hop sent shockwaves through the NBA and influenced an entire generation

programme.title: Miami Vice
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx and Colin Farrell star as undercover detectives who get involved in a case of drug trafficking and murder in South Florida that takes a personal turn

programme.title: America's Sweethearts
programme.desc: For an awkward, self-conscious girl like Kiki (Julia Roberts), being the personal assistant to a beautiful megastar like Gwen (Catherine Zeta-Jones) is no bowl of cherries. But when she reluctantly accepts the task of helping Gwen and her estranged husband (John Cusack) make it through one last public appearance - masterminded by legendary press agent Lee Phillips (Billy Crystal) - Kiki finds her job satisfaction plummeting

programme.title: Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys
programme.desc: Alfre Woodard and Kathy Bates are the matriarchs of two completely different families, one white, the other black; one rich, the other working class, who become best friends despite the odds against them in this comedy-drama costarring Sanaa Lathan

London, 1971. In an age of open racism, fervent nationalism and anti-establishment passion, two politically engaged and idealistic young lovers, Marcus Hill and Jas Mitra, fight back against the injustice and deep-rooted prejudice they face on a daily basis. But, unbeknownst to them, they are being targeted by Special Branch's Black Power Desk, led by police officer DCI Nicholas Pence and his deputy, Cullen. Limited series premiere(n)

programme.title: Sic Transit Imperium
programme.desc: Axe is offered inside information from a former employee and considers whether to use it. Chuck faces external pressure to drop an ongoing investigation. Lara plans a lavish birthday celebration for Axe only to discover he's lied to her about his relationship with Wendy. Chuck is willing to support Ira and Senior's investment in a company about to go public(n)

London, 1971. In an age of open racism, fervent nationalism and anti-establishment passion, two politically engaged and idealistic young lovers, Marcus Hill and Jas Mitra, fight back against the injustice and deep-rooted prejudice they face on a daily basis. But, unbeknownst to them, they are being targeted by Special Branch's Black Power Desk, led by police officer DCI Nicholas Pence and his deputy, Cullen. Limited series premiere(n)

programme.title: My Justice
programme.desc: Online, any of us can become judge, jury and executioner. But in this ever-shifting digital world, how do we draw the line between the rule of law, and a digital lynch mob? In this episode, an amateur sleuth seeks justice in the case of a young woman's mysterious death - only to discover that the accused killer is the real victim. Elsewhere, a digital activist takes a stand for social justice then finds himself forced to choose between prison and exile(n)

programme.title: Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys

programme.title: Big Eyes
programme.desc: Directed by the iconic Tim Burton, this tale is based on the outrageous true story of one of the most epic art frauds in history, which stars Amy Adams as an artist who creates enigmatic paintings of waifs with big eyes, which are appropriated by her husband as his own work, catapulting him to unearned fame(n)

programme.title: The Ghost Writer
programme.desc: An ambitious ghost writer (Ewan McGregor) is hired to pen the forthcoming autobiography of a controversial former British prime minister (Pierce Brosnan) but uncovers an incendiary secret from his subject's past that indicates a vast global conspiracy is controlling world events. Olivia Williams costars in this tense thriller from director Roman Polanski(n)

programme.title: Miami Vice
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx and Colin Farrell star as undercover detectives who get involved in a case of drug trafficking and murder in South Florida that takes a personal turn(n)

programme.title: The Beach Boys: Making Pet Sounds
programme.desc: Celebrating the 50th anniversary of the release of ‘Pet Sounds,' Brian Wilson and surviving members of The Beach Boys (Mike Love, Al Jardine, Bruce Johnston and David Marks) revisit the writing and recording of the landmark record that is consistently voted one of the top three influential albums of all time. Featuring exclusive interviews, classic archive and rare studio outtakes from the recording sessions(n)

programme.title: Safelight
programme.desc: A high-school student tries to help a troubled runaway escape from the clutches of her psychotic pimp by taking a road trip along the California coastline. Stars Juno Temple and Evan Peters(n)

programme.title: Anesthesia
programme.desc: Multiple lives intersect and connect in the aftermath of the brutal assault of a philosophy professor in New York City(n)

programme.title: The Cookout
programme.desc: After he signs a $30 million NBA contract, number-one draft pick Todd Anderson (Storm P) decides to celebrate by inviting his many friends and family to his luxurious mansion for a big cookout - a raucous party that doesn't go over so well with his snooty neighbor the judge (Danny Glover) or his gated community's overly alert security guard (Queen Latifah). Eve, Ja Rule, Farrah Fawcett, Tim Meadows and Jonathan Silverman co-star in this "Barbershop"-style comedy, based on a story by Latifah, who also served as executive producer(n)

programme.title: Poltergeist III
programme.desc: Carole Anne is sent to live in a Chicago high-rise with her Uncle Bruce and his new wife, Pat. But that doesn't mean that she's escaped the apparitions that have haunted her in the past(n)

programme.title: Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
programme.desc: Larry has his life turned upside-down when he's saddled with a rookie partner and assigned to investigate an outbreak of mysterious food poisonings at the city's swankiest restaurants. Infuriating restaurateurs with his bad manners, Larry nevertheless manages to charm a sweet, shy waitress into a budding romance. But when unorthodox methods cost him his health inspector job, Larry has to go undercover to bring the conspirators to justice(n)

programme.title: The Beach Boys: Making Pet Sounds

Featuring exclusive interviews, classic archive and rare studio outtakes from the recording sessions(n)

programme.desc: As a church camp group prepares for a devout spring break vacation, a demonic logger rises from his sap boiler to wreak vengeance and feast on flapjacks soaked in the blood of his victims

programme.title: I Survived a Zombie Holocaust
programme.desc: Fresh from film school, an enthusiastic young runner starts work on a low budget zombie movie only to run into the first day from hell as a mystery illness starts to turn the extras on set into the bona fide undead

programme.title: Gravy
programme.desc: Comic horror flick about a group of employees in a Mexican Cantina who are terrorized by a trio of cannibals, who lock the staff in the restaurant and go on a Halloween night killing spree. Stars Sutton Foster

programme.title: Star Kid
programme.desc: A dorky seventh grader who spends his days avoiding the class bully and dreaming of becoming a comic book hero gets to try on the superpower he's always wanted when an extraterrestrial spacecraft crashes on earth

programme.title: The Bleeding
programme.desc: Returning from duty in Afghanistan, a combat veteran (Michael Matthias) is dismayed to discover that his parents are dead and that his own brother has become a vampire king of the nosferatu. There's only thing for a red-blooded American hero to do: enlist the aid of a highly unusual priest (Michael Madsen) and go to war against his own sibling. Armand Assante costars in this fun, action-packed horror romp

programme.title: Why Horror?
programme.desc: Documentary following horror fan Tal Zimerman as he travels around the world to understand why people thrive on blood and gore, and meets with the genre's leading filmmakers, writers, actors and psychologists to discover how horror is portrayed in different cultures

programme.desc: A vengeful spirit takes the form of the Tooth Fairy to destroy the inhabitants of a town that lynched her 150 years earlier

programme.title: The Howling Reborn
programme.desc: Will (Landon Liboiron) is a young man harboring a secret crush on pretty classmate Eliana (Lindsey Shaw) and even bigger secret about his past: he's the son of a werewolf and may have supernatural gifts of his own. When a mysterious attack reveals that a werewolf army is being assembled by someone from his past, he's torn between his true nature and his love for Eliana. This reboot of the "Howling" horror franchise costars Ivana Milicevic

Joshua Jackson and Margot Finlay star with Teri Garr and Alexandra Purvis in this contemporary reworking of Shakespeare's "Romeo and Juliet."
